description:
A better tick control for dogs

Sunday’s Pet Protect Bug Spray & Repellent is formulated with natural cedarwood and soybean oil to shield pets from biting pests.

This ready-to-use spray kills adult and larval ticks, fleas, and mosquitoes on contact and continues to repel after drying. The combination of essential oils not only controls pests on dogs and pet areas but also leaves a pleasant woodsy cedar scent.

Sunday creates effective pest control solutions that care for your home and the world around it.

sections.product_features:
Safer* flea and tick spray for dogs
Scientifically proven to kill and repel ticks, fleas, and mosquitoes
Effective up to 4 days on dogs, 1 week on pet areas
Has a refreshing cedar scent
Easy to spray and apply safely
Suitable for year-round use
For dogs over 5 lbs. and pet areas
Includes one 24 oz. bottle of Pet Protect Bug Spray & Repellent
sections.ingredients: Cedarwood Oil: Natural essential oil known for its insect-repellent properties.
sections.instructions:
Use Pet Protect Bug Spray & Repellent when ticks, fleas, and mosquitoes are prevalent in your area, ideally outdoors or in a well-ventilated space. Shake well before use.
Spray directly onto your dog's coat, avoiding the nose and eyes. Massage the product into the fur using your hands for even coverage.
Reapply as needed: Follow label instructions for reapplication to maintain protection.
We recommend a sensitivity test: Spray a small area on your pet or pet bedding and wait 24 hours to observe any reactions before proceeding with full application. If sensitivity occurs, stop using.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Yard Advisors:
Can I use Pet Protect Bug Spray & Repellent with another tick prevention product on my dog?
If you wish to use another tick-prevention product alongside Pet Protect, we recommend consulting your veterinarian first.
When do I apply Pet Protect Bug Spray & Repellent on my dog?
Apply Pet Protect when ticks, fleas, and mosquitoes are active—typically from spring
through fall when temperatures are above 40–45°F, or year-round in warmer climates.
What's the difference between Sunday’s Pet Protect Bug Spray & Repellent and Nix Ticks?
Pet Protect is designed for use on dogs and pet areas to kill and repel ticks, fleas, and mosquitoes. Nix Ticks is intended for application on plants and foliage in your yard and should not be used on pets or pet areas.
When will I see results?
Pet Protect kills pests on contact and repels new ticks for 2–4 days once dry. Reapply as needed and apply to pet bedding weekly to prevent indoor pests.
Is there a risk of staining?
Oils may temporarily discolor light-colored fur but will fade or wash out. For pet areas, test on an inconspicuous spot before full application, as some fabrics may stain.
Any state restrictions?
Yes, this product is not approved for use in the following states:
IN
